intro: Cinchona cordifolia var. peruviana, commonly known as Peruvian quinine tree, is a species native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and ornamental, fragrant flowers. The plant is notable for its historical use in the production of quinine, a compound used to treat malaria. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments at moderate elevations. Its botanical features include elliptical leaves and clustered inflorescences that bloom in spring.
